definition: many/much/often/a lot of/numerous/more/in excess/how (to what extent)/multi-/Taiwan pr. [duo2] when it means "how"

sentences.english: Many places have dazzling displays that light up the night.
sentences.chinese: 很多地方都有能够点亮这个夜晚的绚丽多彩的表演。

sentences.english: The bright national dress, the school was dressed more blew.
sentences.chinese: 那鲜艳的民族服装，把学校打扮得更加绚丽多彩。

sentences.english: And I should pray for the glory of a colorful sunset.
sentences.chinese: 而我也将为能够看到绚丽多彩的落日余辉而祈祷。

sentences.english: Life is as colorful as sunshine, and competes with each other for beauty of looks like flowers.
sentences.chinese: 生活就像阳光一样绚丽多彩，就像花儿一样争奇斗艳。

sentences.english: Colorful past of the earth into a powder makeup jade puzzle world.
sentences.chinese: 往日绚丽多彩的大地变成了粉妆玉砌的世界。

sentences.english: This paper makes an introduction to these multicoloured silk articles.
sentences.chinese: 文章对这些绚丽多彩的楚汉丝织品作了介绍。

sentences.english: Their clothes were so colourful that I could not stop taking photos.
sentences.chinese: 他们的服装如此绚丽多彩以致于我不能停止拍照。

sentences.english: Life is a great big canvas, and you should throw all the paint on it you can.
sentences.chinese: 人生是一幅大画布，你就应发奋绘出绚丽多彩的画面。

sentences.english: I expect you appearing to make every day colorful in life.
sentences.chinese: 我期待你的出现，让生命中的每一天都变得绚丽多彩。

sentences.english: He should have new clothes made of this splendid cloth.
sentences.chinese: 他应该用这块绚丽多彩的布料做一身新衣服。

sentences.english: In the evening the rosy clouds were gorgeous.
Though more than 300 years old, the feather coat has remained bright and colorful.
sentences.chinese: 虽然有300多年了，但羽绒衣仍然绚丽多彩。

definition: all the colors in profusion (idiom); a garish display
elegant and graceful posture/splendid, full of content
bright and multicolored/of rich variety/(fig.) dazzling/glitzy
see 五彩繽紛|五彩缤纷[wu3 cai3 bin1 fen1]
nothing more beautiful can be imagined (idiom)
lit. flowing light and overflowing color/brilliant lights and vibrant colors (idiom)
